website_summaries.verdict: This mug keeps liquid hot for hours on end and is large enough to use for not only just coffee, but also soups and food.
pros: This mug is conveniently to carry and fill with coffee
Say goodbye to the need to microwave your morning java over and over again as this mug keeps it warm for hours
Comes with a lid and is available in several colors
cons: Doesn’t fit in most cup holders

customer_reviews.title: Keeps mama’s coffee warm!
customer_reviews.text: I have a toddler and she keeps me very busy so I kept coming back to cold coffee. It was getting really old so I started putting it in my 30 oz Yeti Rambler. It worked great but I really prefer a mug. I was so excited to come across this! It’s perfect. I actually have to leave the lid off for a bit so it can cool down enough to drink! If I get up and won’t be able to come back and drink it for awhile I just put the lid on and it stays warm till I get back to it. Definitely recommend for toddler mamas!
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Not the typical Yet quality
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to have a coffee mug to keep my coffee warm at my desk. A typical mug let's it get cold quickly. I have the taller Rambler Yeti, but wanted a mug for my desk. This kept my coffee no warmer than a regular ceramic coffee mug. It also came with a a scratch on the mug. This is not the typical Yet quality that I am used to. I have several Yeti items and they keep hot/cold for hours as advertised. Maybe this one is a dud. Oh well, hopefully I can send it back.
customer_reviews.author: J Church

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a great product. I’ve transitioned from a regular coffee cup to this. I was always reheating my coffee but no longer. This mug keeps my coffee hot for a minimum of 2 hours. Allowing me to get a few things done around the house, while i enjoy my coffee here and there.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Hubick

customer_reviews.title: The only thing is that I didn’t like drinking from it as the ledge is too thick ...
customer_reviews.text: It does keep things hot or cold. The only thing is that I didn’t like drinking from it as the ledge is too thick and I don’t like drinking with the lid on it.
customer_reviews.author: dodiandjoug

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Like the product, does its job of keeping coffee hot longer than your average mug (about 1.5 hours). Wish it came with magnaslider lid and didn’t have to buy one separately. But for reference the 30 oz. tumber lid does fit it. It’s a little bit of a bulky mug with an awkward handle, but I’m happy with it
customer_reviews.author: K&A12

customer_reviews.title: Keeping my coffee hot!
customer_reviews.text: This might be the first time I've ever reviewed a product. I am giving this a one because the only reason I purchased it was to keep my coffee hot. I did not rate the durability or quality because I've only had it for a couple of days now. It does not keep the coffee hot. Very disappointed. If this is the only reason you are buying this cup, don't do it!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Vernola

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful product. Keeps my coffee hot for longer and ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful product. Keeps my coffee hot for longer and cold drink cool. With other cups my coffee would get cool within 10 minutes. With this baby it' still warm after half a hour, and that's with the lid it came with, which is with a fixed hole and cannot be closed. I have a feeling that it'd stay hot/cool for much longer with the magslider lid. Must get for people who tend to let their drink sit there for extended period of time while focusing on work. Edit: 12/13/2017 2 hours with the included lid, filled with coffee from k-cup machine, still warm and going strong!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Liang

customer_reviews.title: Pronghorn Outfitters delivers fast
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and function of this Yeti 14 oz mug with handle Pronghorn Outfitters delivered super quickly even though it was not on Prime shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: doesn't keep warm at all. what's the point of getting this mug.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I loved the look of this mug but beware, doesn’t keep coffee hot. In an hour it’s warm at best. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: DKS

customer_reviews.title: Knock off YETI—FAKE
customer_reviews.text: These mugs aren’t authentic YETI products, and don’t work as good as the real thing! The quality is much cheaper. Since these mugs/cups are FAKES, I’m unsure of what they are made of, and I have concerns as to whether they are safe to use. BTW this company IS NOT authorized to sell YETI products. So disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Tiffani Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a YETI thermal product before but after getting Keurig for Christmas I thought I would spend a premium and get a quality thermal cup to drink my coffee. Don't WASTE YOUR MONEY on a YETI. I tend to drink my coffee slow while working at my desk. But this high dollar YETI doesn't even keep a cup of coffee warm for two hours. My cheap thermal coffee cups I get from Walmart will keep the coffee warm and drinkable for 4-5 hours. I would advise saving your money and spending it on a real thermal cup and not this terrible YETI product. This will be the first and last YETI product for me.
customer_reviews.author: JohnC

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your stuff hot
customer_reviews.text: This is a BIG mug. It can easily be used for stews and soups, not just coffee. Works great for coffee, however. With the lid on, keeps it hot and steamy far longer than a regular mug. Strangely the Yeti web site prices these much lower than what they are going for on the web. But, they are perpetually out of stock. I suspect some sleazy marketing going on here.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep coffee hot
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. My coffee is cold within the hour, even with the lid on the whole time. Is this a legit yeti product or a knock off? I threw away the packaging after opening so I am unable to return the product. I am so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RMWF

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with this cup, But I have to say I think they are way overrated for the price. I own several of these types of things for cold and hot drinks (reduce, mybevi, gold armour) I thought I would splurge and get this brand that everyone raves about (Yeti) while it does keep my drink warm it’s nothing special at all, in fact I find myself grabbing my reduce mug way more often than the yeti. The reduce keeps drinks warmer longer!
customer_reviews.author: HazelBlueJays

customer_reviews.title: Cute but doesn’t hold temperature
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t even keep my coffee at room temp for more than an hour. If I hadn’t already used I would return. 10/10 would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powder coating is chipped
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a gift and upon taking it out of the plastic package I noticed the white coating is chipped on the handle. Not enough time to return and get another one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Banks

customer_reviews.title: Not Suitable for My Needs.
customer_reviews.text: Probably a decent mug for "in-office" use but it's too large to fit into your car cup holder and too heavy for the use I purchased it for - backpacking. This baby comes in at nearly a pound! My own fault for not reviewing the specifications more carefully (although the spec's say 13 oz, I weighed mine and it came in at 14.5 oz...maybe because I weighed with the lid?). Anyway, I'd keep it for the car but, as mentioned, it's too big for the cup holders to will return.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your coffee hot!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, keeps my coffee hot. That’s exactly why I bought it. Kind of expensive but you get what you pay for. Didn’t give it five stars because it should have a rubber bottom, I think. I solved that problem by applying self adhesive neoprene to the bottom. Now it doesn’t KLUNK every time you put in down.
customer_reviews.author: PJB

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Did not keep my coffee hot. It did not live up to the hype the product boasts.
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor Gosda

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am really sorry to say this cup did not live up to my expectations. I bought this bc I recently broke my leg & getting up to rewarm my coffee was difficult,. My friend recommended this & I read the reviews & was so excited to receive my YETI. This cup doesn't keep my coffee hot for more then maybe an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Barbi

customer_reviews.title: Not copper!!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful Mug and of course, it’s a Yeti! BUT!!! And that’s a big but. Like Niki ménage. It’s not copper like in the pics. Far from it. It’s more of a bronze once you open the box. The pics are totally non representative of what you will be getting so keep that in mind. If you are like for the bright copper that you are accustomed to, this is not it!!! Going to take me a bit to get used to but I’m ok with it. I give it 4 stars because I didn’t get what I imagined I would. My expectations were set on copper. 😢
customer_reviews.author: Buddha Noir

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: One of the best Yeti products yet! However, it doesn’t fit in standard-sized car cup holders. You’ve been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Namaste_in_bed

customer_reviews.title: Cool mug keeps my coffee hot!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps coffee hot for a long while. No need in squawking at the cost (it's the most expensive coffee cup I've ever owned lol) as I could have any cup but I'm just not an any coffee cup kinda girl. It's solid. The thing I don't like is that I have to purchase a lid that can be closed to prevent spills seperately. Argh!
customer_reviews.author: Precious

customer_reviews.title: Compared to Stainless Steel Mug
customer_reviews.text: I bought this yeti mug and a same size stainless steel mug. This mug is slightly heavier in weight than the comparison ss mug by 1 oz. Yeti weighs 16 oz. Stainless Steel mug 15 oz. They are both about the same size inside 3" high and 3 3/4" in diameter. I put hot coffee into each mug and after 30 min the Yeti mug coffee was 115 degrees and the SS mug was 110, even tho the SS has a slide top to close which I kept closed the entire time. Overall, I'd go with Yeti if you like hot. The 5 degree different was noticeable for hot coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Nies

customer_reviews.title: If you like cold coffee this mug is for you
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed with this mug. The coffee doesn't stay warm, the lid is a joke (not spill proof and plastic so any hope of keeping the heat in is lost), and although tnx to my husband I basically drive a monster truck, no cup holders will fit this giant mug. I really wanted something that didn't have a ton of parts (I'm paranoid about getting my coffee mug ultra clean) and this does get clean but cold coffee is not my jam. Disappointed and in the market for a new mug :(
customer_reviews.author: CarlosColtrane

customer_reviews.title: Don’t know how there’s so many positive reviews...
customer_reviews.text: I got a Knock off Yeti. I know this bc I’ve had authentic Yetis. It looks right but doesn’t keep coffee hot long at all AND after washing and leaving a bit of water inside it started to RUST! This is now the third or forth Knock off item I’ve received on Amazon. One was a baby skincare product! Pretty scary. Sadly, I’m now having to be very cautious with what I buy on Amazon, until they start setting higher standards for sellers or more monitoring of sellers
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Horrible lid.  I haven't had a hot cup of coffee yet!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how anyone is keeping their coffee hot with this lid. I've had it for a week and it's been cold every time. I ended up buying the mag lid but I was dumb and didn't read the amazon reviews before purchasing. Since this is a 14oz mug, I bought the 10/20 oz magslider lid. Apparently you need to buy the 30oz lid. I'll exchange and try again but if this doesn't work I'm returning everything and sticking to a freebie mug I got from a consultant. I expected better.
customer_reviews.author: Goodpeople

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work like a YETI
customer_reviews.text: Is this a real YETI because it surely doesn’t act like one? Really disappointed with this purchase. Does not act anything like an insulated mug/tumbler in terms of keeping things warm. My tea and coffee gets just as cold, as quickly, as when I use a regular mug. Something is definitely off here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my coffee hot to the last drop!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE MY YETI MUG WITH LID!! When I drink my coffee in the morning, I want it to stay hot until I take the last sip. This mug keeps it hot until the last drop. The mug is the perfect size holding 14 oz easily. I am so glad I purchased this little mug because it is making my morning coffee even more of a pleasure to drink!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Gillaspie

customer_reviews.title: Chipped paint, pricey item
customer_reviews.text: Paint came chipped on several parts of the handle, which was really disappointing at this price point. They are good, but very expensive. I feel like you are just paying for the name, and could receive a product that is exactly the same for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rowena

customer_reviews.title: Piece of tin, does not work
customer_reviews.text: This is a joke! First About the one that keeps things cold and it did not. So I thought I would try the one that keeps things hot. It is a simple little tin cup. My tea was hot for about 10 seconds. I keep my tea cup in my hand in the morning so I did not lay it down and walk away. I’ve already put it in the dishwasher so I know I cannot return it but I will never buy anything from this fake company again. That is completely false advertising
customer_reviews.author: Anne Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great YETI Item
customer_reviews.text: Great insulated mug. I actually use it for coffee and an afternoon toddy. I love these Yeti glasses, I have the travel mugs, the 10 oz mugs and now this one and all are great and NEVER get moisture on the outside like other copies do. I like in deep south Louisiana with hot humid weather all the time so I am familiar with moisture covered glasses is all about. I have tried a lot of the copies and they don't work like the YETI does.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Mills

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I typically use a brand name, double-walled glass mug. It holds about eight ounces. I bought this because I thought it would be convenient to have a mug that held a larger amount and kept it hot throughout. It definitely holds more (equivalent to about a glass and a half of the double walled mug) but it cooled off faster than the glass. Sorry, nothing special here for $25.
customer_reviews.author: Dylon

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement
customer_reviews.text: These are great for Nespresso Virtuoline. Put some cream in it and it is perfect size. Really like the flat bottoms and handle.
customer_reviews.author: John Online Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Rusting in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Got this mug for my wife for her birthday in March now not even December (8 months) and it is already rusting on the inside. I got it to match a YETI Travell Mug she already had for a couple of years which still looks like new. This may be a counterfeit YETI. I bought a Trudeau Stainless Steel mug 7 years age that I use every day and it still looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Medugno

customer_reviews.title: Not a YETI staple product
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted to like this product. I really did. I have the 20 oz rambler which I love. But this little guy doesn't fit in my cup holder, doesn't come with the maglid slider and being honest, when full, is a bit wonky to hold. The 20 oz rambler nails all these so I ended up buying that instead. I get the idea of being a coffee mug sells itself but I believe in having quality staple products instead. In the case for YETI being an exceptional product compared to my Hydroflash and Takeya, it really is as good as it gets.
customer_reviews.author: heidi gwinner

customer_reviews.title: the perfect coffee mug
customer_reviews.text: Everyone at my work wants one, too now. It's a nice, generous size and keeps my drinks warm. I love how the lid is slanted towards the drink opening. I also keep one by my bed if I get thirsty in the middle of the night and for taking my pills in the morning. It keeps the dust and any small flying suckers out. I already have one at work and one at home but I might even get another because it really is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: BonnieB

customer_reviews.title: Big, Heavy, Awkward
customer_reviews.text: I have the 20oz rambler and love it. I bought the 14oz because I wanted something a little smaller. The problem is that the 14oz cup is huge! And it is heavy, at least as heavy at my 20oz, but it feels heavier holding it by the handle. And it is awkward to drink out of it because it has such a large opening. I returned it. I will continue to use my 20oz rambler, even when I am only drinking 12oz of tea.
customer_reviews.author: MoodyRose79

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: So i spend a good deal of money for a coffee mug that its sole basis is for the beverage to stay hot for an extended period of time, but it comes with a lid with a hole in it that cannot be closed. What is the purpose of spending all this money on this high tech mug when all the heat escapes through the top? Answer. To spend another 10 bucks on a lid with with magnets that closes to keep your beverage hot. Why didn't this lid come with it? Its a scam. If I would have known this I would have never bought it. Irritated
customer_reviews.author: JerseyJeff

customer_reviews.title: Worst design I can imagine
customer_reviews.text: Hi everyone...mug is very heavy with an extremely uncomfortable handle. I have big strong hands and the handle begins to hurt my fingers....it should have rounded (radiuses) sides on the handle grip..it's hard to hold without using the handle so prepare for some pain.. Seriously, no closing lid?..The lid sip hole has no way to close it!..You will spill on yourself if u take it in the truck and the non closing hole LET'S ALL THE HEAT OUT !... Incredibly bad engineering on this expensive coffee mug..Sad
customer_reviews.author: steven henry

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep my drinks cold/hot!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the cup for 2 reasons: 1. It would fit under the coffee machine at work, but still hold a lot of coffee, success. 2. Yeti has a reputation for good products, failed. This wont even keep my coffee cold/hot on my 15min ride to work. By the time i get to the office its already room temperature. Yeti cheaped out on this product for sure. They couldnt have even been bothered to add a lid that seals completely. I havent checked yet but I can bet theres a lid you can purchase separately for about half the cost of the cup.
customer_reviews.author: letto

customer_reviews.title: Bad design all over
customer_reviews.text: I understand that the camping mug has to have certain look and so does this Yeti mug. But why so wide? Only place it can sit resting is on the ground. It does not fit in ANY holders. That's not really the problem. I'm not picky. I can live with that. What's really bad is the opening of the lid. Be aware that no matter how well you angle it to take a sip, it will overflow thru that stupid opening and burn your mouth and chin. The reason I'm writing this review is because I got burned three times. I have three-strike policy for pretty everything in life. So it's in the trash now.
customer_reviews.author: Chi Kyeong In

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping, but not as a travel mug
customer_reviews.text: Such a cute color and a great mug. I wanted to use this as a coffee mug at work, instead of the taller coffee mugs. The only problem is that the top does not close and so my coffee sloshes out on the way to work. It does keep the coffee warm, but if it's a travel mug, I recommend getting one of the taller mugs that close. This would be great for camping, because it could be used for coffee, oatmeal, soup, etc. Keep in mind, though, that you cannot use it to cook in, since you cannot put it over a flame or heat source.
customer_reviews.author: Eva D Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy to find Yeti made a coffee/slash soup cup. The cup comes with a clear cap that has a strong seal. It is large but fits well in my hand with the handle. I like that I can see what I have in it. Used this morning and it kept my coffee a perfect drinking temp. Not too hot can't sip. Not lukewarm but hot enough to comfortably enjoy my coffee. This will be a staple on my outside patio table.
customer_reviews.author: vs

customer_reviews.title: Dented and not as described.
customer_reviews.text: Much Darker than pictured. More Bronze than Cooper. Arrived dented; exchanging it and hoping for the best... better packaging would be nice. -will update upon replacement
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Terrific cup/mug
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the taller cups are too difficult to get my hand into to clean/dry at the office. This one is perfect for cleaning, and keeps tea hot for pretty long, though I will be ordering a mag slider lid so my tea doesn't get lukewarm before I can finish it. Despite needing to buy another lid, I am very satisfied with this cup, and would highly recommend it. It comes in great colors, too!
customer_reviews.author: Theodora

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have a Yeti tumbler that’s incredible. It holds temperature for hours. This coffee mug is the polar opposite. The walls are much thinner and the interior space is much larger, making it harder for it to hold temperature. The result is that my I offer gets colder faster than in a regular ceramic or glass coffee mug. If you are considering this mug based on Yeti’s reputation for holding temperature, don’t. You’ll be just as disappointed as I am.
customer_reviews.author: S. Long

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy, retains heat, but not as long as you'd think
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for home use to keep my tea nice and hot, which it does, but not for as long as i'd expected. But that's still ok. My main issue is with the lid itself which can form an almost impossible-to-take-off level of suction, which, when paired with boiling hot liquids, is a pain in the a$$ to remove. That said, it keeps liquids pretty hot for a decent duration, is easy to hold using the handle, but is a bit large for holding without the handle. Keeps your hands cool from the heat so you never have to worry about holding a burning hot cup. Bit expensive for what it is, but i'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I've made this year
customer_reviews.text: I use this mug every day to have my coffee. Sometimes I want hot, sometimes I want cold - either way, the mug insulates my coffee really well. I love being able to look into the cup still even when the lid is on. It's also extremely easy to clean and can go in the dishwasher. The only downside is that I can't bring this in the car with it full of something - it doesn't fit in a cup holder, and my lid doesn't close. I hardly run into this issue though, because by the end of the day I have finished my coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great mug with just a couple drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: I love this mug, but it's not perfect so that's why I give it 4 Stars. It is nice to hold, the handle is wide for chunky fingers or to fit many. It's stable, so you can set it on your couch cushions while you read the paper and not have to worry about tipping. The cons, if you want beverages to stay hot, this yeti doesn't do the trick as well. But, you can buy the yeti rambler slider lid and that does help it a bit, but it's an extra $10. It also doesn't fit in the car or standard cup holders, otherwise, it's a great mug.
customer_reviews.author: meesh

customer_reviews.title: Great looking mug but has limitations.
customer_reviews.text: My main issue with the YETI Rambler is the standard lid that it comes with. The opening in the lid is never covered, so it releases heat from my coffee quickly, which is not necessarily what anyone who buys a YETI mug is looking for. I also dislike how the lid needs to be strategically positioned to how you're generally going to hold the mug (e.g., which had is going to lift it, where the opening of the lid is place, etc.). It's a sharp looking mug, but I have to admit that I was influenced by social media into purchasing it and was pretty disappointed (especially due to the price).
customer_reviews.author: Nicolle

customer_reviews.title: Love it, just one thing
customer_reviews.text: Love the shape and feel, does a great job with heating and cooling the drinks. Only pet peeve is that it's a big pain to get the lid on and off. Half the time I have to put enough force to pull it off that the lid goes flying. There is a little plastic pull tab on the lid but it doesn't take away from how much force you have to use. Makes it annoying when I want frequent refills.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item based on "glowing" reviews. Guess they got a different mug than I did. First of all, it is OVERPRICED!! Although it seems fairly well made. It is VERY HEAVY! Does not keep coffee hot for very long. Lukewarm describes it better. I purchased another less expensive mug, that is great. Does everything this one advertises, but doesn't. Save your money on this one. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mldal

customer_reviews.title: Not blown away...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Yeti product and I was really excited about it, despite mixed reviews. It keeps my coffee hot for an hour. It keeps it warm for another hour, after that... it's room temperature. I use it when I work from home as love to sip my coffee all morning (from 7am to about 10am). I don't have to reheat my coffee (yuck!) as often as I did with a coffee cup, but my $20 Starbucks travel cup from 10 years ago works the same as this...and closes completely, so no spills. I will still use this when at home because I prefer a mug with a handle, but I was not blown away by this Rambler.
customer_reviews.author: thejuniorscoutTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great insulated cup
customer_reviews.text: This cup is great: 1) Wide mouth, but keep things VERY well insulated with the cap on, especially if you get the lid that had a magnet latch to cover the hole 2)Great construction to take out in the woods and get banged around 3) Easy to clean, esp because you can put it in the dishwasher Needs improvement: 1) It doesn't insulate well without the cap on 2) The cap is hard to remove, especially with hot liquids inside. It would be nice to take on an off more easily. As it is, I only remove when it's time to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Warm Coffee for Hours
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for work. We moved to a new building that is big, drafty, and cold. My particular office doesn't have heat (they are working on it.) I found my coffee was getting cold quick, and I hate cold coffee - yuck! This YETI cup works very well in keeping my coffee warm for several hours. The handle is comfortable to hold; however, the cup is so big around that I can't grab it without the handle. It's super easy to clean, and because it is stainless steel, it doesn't stain. I liked it so much that I purchased one for a white elephant gift party.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Not diggin' the Yeti
customer_reviews.text: Okay so this mug had 5 stars with about 30,000 reviews-- that's insane! This mug specifically had no closure to the mouth of it, so I felt as though that is why it lost heat more than other insulated cups I own. I have a Starbucks one that stays hotter longer, so I decided to return the Yeti and just continue using the one. have. My thought was that I would use this cup in replacement of others because I hate heating up my coffee all the time. After 2-3 hours my coffee went from hot to luke warm. Not what I was looking for-- for me, not worth $30.
customer_reviews.author: TrishTop Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: Most over engineered cup ever...in a good way
customer_reviews.text: What a great coffee cup, it's heavy and we'll built. I do like the finish on it it looks great! I like how there aren't weld marks all over meaning the vacuum seal is actually vacuum sealed without spots for air to leak. It keeps the hots hot and colds cold for sure. I also like the fact that it has a 5yr warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff szyarto

customer_reviews.title: Great mug!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these. (One of them arrived with a chip in the handle that I hope does not spread.) VERY happy with these mugs. Great size. They don't tip over. The outside stays cold while the coffee stays hot. In fact, they keep the coffee *really* hot -- we learned to leave the lid off at first to get it down to "to temperature" so we could drink it. Then the lid kept it at-temperature for well over an hour. (I know this because we left our mugs half-full and came back an hour later and it was still the same temp.) Very happy with the purchase. I understand why these are pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Miz Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Could not recomend not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: this was to take hot liquids with you. First issue was the lid does not close meaning it has a hole to drink from which cannot be closed if you want to have a lid to close you must buy it separately, another $ 10. So I used my lid from my 30ounce cup to seal the cup to take to work. At lunch time my soup was tepid and the cup has metal so it cant be microwaved. I have a 30 oz cup for cold it works great. First time I have had to write a negative review because I research items before purchasing them. Hope this helps you to make intelligent purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix128

customer_reviews.title: Can you go wrong with Yeti? Not Really.
customer_reviews.text: Love yeti quality. This mug is a bit heavy for the size but I like it. The outside of the mug gets really cold quickly if outside in colder temps so when I’m using this to drink outside, I have to put something around it or use gloves. I only mention this because I bought this for the sole purpose of enjoying coffee while waking my dogs in the morning and thought it would keep my coffee warmer longer but it doesn’t keep it warmer than any other cup. I love the cup and know it will hold up for long time, but not the outdoor cup I was wanting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Great cup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my coffee and tea get cold before I can drink it. I have a 32 oz cup which can keep hot and cold forever it seems so I thought I would try this for home. It works and does what I need it to. Now it does not keep like the big guy but I really did not expect that. I make the coffe and lid it...lid has a slit...the temperature gradually cools it down but slowly and it depends how cold the air is. I am happy with the product my coffee stays hot for a reasonable time and I don't have to hurry to drink it.
customer_reviews.author: Here KittyKitty

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: The mug is a great size. I use it every morning since my toddler put a piece of trash in my old mug and also I barely get a chance to finish my coffee before it gets cold in a regular mug. My friend raves about the mug but I have to say it doesn’t keep liquids as hot as I imagined. The lid has an opening so the heat leaks out faster than I need as a busy mom of two, but I can just switch the lid out. I’ll still continue to use this daily and it definitely keeps liquids colder longer but I was just a tad disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Rice

customer_reviews.title: Yeti Reputation
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the color selections (especially mine) and the shape and feel of the mug/Rambler is perfect. However, I am not impressed by the "thermal" aspect of it. It does not keep my coffee as hot as other non-descript travel cups that I have. I was surprised because Yeti products are so well known and quite costly. My son has broken several of my coffee mugs so he decided to buy me the Yeti Rambler for it's durability. It is durable but I don't think that I would invest in any more Yeti products. Overall I like it, it just doesn't out perform my other travel mugs/cups.
customer_reviews.author: Angela McCann

customer_reviews.title: what a fantastic mug!
customer_reviews.text: these mugs are so great, i’ve bought several for my husband & coworkers as gifts. as a chef, my coworkers are cooks and we’re (mostly) also professional beverage guzzlers. these mugs suit the range of our varying needs. the low profile design makes it virtually impossible to tip over. and although the vented sip lid isn’t spill proof, i’ve only ever displaced drinks from being a renegade and overfilling. it’s exactly enough to keep it from sloshing, while being insulating and easy to sip from. it’s also a sturdy cup to carry on the playa. easy portability, solid dust coverage, and a good size with room for ice.
customer_reviews.author: mama t.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t keep beverage hot
customer_reviews.text: So, I like the cup. It is very well made, it it does not keep contents hot for a long period of time. First of all, the plastic lid has an uncovered opening in it, so heat escapes immediately. It would be perfect it the opening in the lid had a little cover, then I imagine my coffee would stay hot for longer. I still use it, but I expected something different/better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Mixed
customer_reviews.text: I got the chartreuse because it was the cheapest! Kinda like it. I bought it for the handle, mostly. It’s nice to hold... high quality. Tried cold water from my water cooler-with ice. Stayed cold for quite q while. My coffee... not so much! It has an open lid! I ordered the slider lid... not sure why they do this.. same with Healthy Human. Bunch of those, had to buy lids that open. I feel like these tactics are a total rip-off! Because now I have a bunch of lids I’ll never use! Other than that; like this mug! For now; 3 stars!
customer_reviews.author: ScrappyKel

customer_reviews.title: Keep the coffee warm with this cup
customer_reviews.text: YETI makes great insulated products - and this mug is no exception. It is LARGE and comes with a clear, tight fitting lid. Sturdy and durable and keeps my coffee warm way longer than a regular ceramic mug does. It's not designed as a commuter mug (so not cupholder friendly, and don't put it in your bag), but is AWESOME at keeping hot stuff hot and cold stuff cold. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: ASM

customer_reviews.title: A great cup for the car!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Yeti products. The cup and my tall beverage container are both great to take to the car for keeping my drinks either hot or cold. Best of all they are unbreakable. I love it so much I got one for my husband for Christmas. He has broken so many of our cups from our dish set from taking them with him in his work truck. Now he can take along a hot cup of cocoa with the Yeti cup and the dishes can remain intact! What a relief! They are great for camping too, or any time we travel. I am never without my Yeti cup or tall beverage container.
customer_reviews.author: Pacj

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, but not functional.
customer_reviews.text: Aesthetically, 5/5. This Yeti Mug is so pretty and easy to keep clean, and I love that part. What I don't love? The fact that it's huge circumference doesn't fit in my cup holder. I can't see it fitting in many cup holders, either. AND since it comes with a lid that doesn't freaking close, I'm hot mess express every time I bring this cup into the car. The fact that you have to buy a slider lid for an additional price just doesn't make any sense. That being said, my coffee stays warm and the cup looks nice. Functionally, you'd be better off with another cup that fits cup holders and CLOSES.
customer_reviews.author: D.Dunstock

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY
customer_reviews.text: OK so I've been eyeing yeti but haven't bought because you can get similar products for half the price. Finally bit the bullet and IT WAS SO WORTH EVERY PENNY!!! I didn't realize how quickly my coffee was cooling off until I bought this and burnt my tongue the first time I used it. I also didnt realize I was trying to rush through my daily cup just to keep it from getting lukewarm. This thing is a GAME CHANGER. Probably my best purchase of the year so far, which sounds silly because its only a mug. But let me tell you, it is THE MUG.
customer_reviews.author: Erv

customer_reviews.title: Dented upon arrival :(
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to purchase my first YETI. However, I was quickly disappointed when I removed this item from the package and it was dented. The label states that it should resist dents and dings. Either it was handled poorly by Amazon, or the product is faulty.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: I love black coffee
customer_reviews.text: I love black coffee. This is the perfect thing for drinking coffee at the computer. It keeps it hot for a long time and unlike a taller thermos it is hard to tip over and not cumbersome to drink from.
customer_reviews.author: William Vance

customer_reviews.title: Great Mug
customer_reviews.text: While the mug is a little heavy, it's well balanced and will not tip over. The handle is sturdy and allows me to get all four fingers in the opening and with thumb on top, it's comfortable. It keeps my coffee hot for at least a couple of hours as it comes out from my Keurig. The only thing I'd wish for is a Magslide 30 oz. lid be shipped with the mug, rather than having to buy one separately. I've replaced my Swell 12 oz. tumbler with this mug since I'm working from home these days.
customer_reviews.author: knitsistah

customer_reviews.title: I love hot coffee!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter gave me for Mother’s Day last year the larger YETI for travel. I loved it so much that I recently purchased this one for my home office. I find it keeps my coffee hot long enough but because the cover has a hole that you cannot close, it does not keep my coffee hot as long as my travel mug does, hence the 4 stars, not 5. I wish they would have made the cover exactly as the travel mug has with the closable hole in it for I really do love my coffee piping hot. Otherwise, it is very well made, easy to clean and better than a regular open mug.
customer_reviews.author: graceygirl

customer_reviews.title: Over priced - inefficient
customer_reviews.text: Too much money for a mug that has such a large surface area - nothing stays hot or cold for long. I also have some handmade double wall glass mugs - they are spectacular and cost about same - but you get 2.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Love that it can hold a huge cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Love that it can hold a huge cup of coffee. However, I wish the lid had something to close the opening.
customer_reviews.author: Arwa

customer_reviews.title: two out of three
customer_reviews.text: bought a blue one works great, bought an orange one works great, bought a purple one it leaked like crazy and they replaced it and the replacement leaks too. It leaked with the lids from the other two also. The other two didn't leak with the lids from the purple ones. I'm thinking the die that punched out the purple ones is probably shot but no ones going to tell me that. I haven't sent the original one back yet because the the nearest UPS Store to me is an hour away now I have a second one to send back. They are way to expensive to be giving me these kinds of problems.
customer_reviews.author: rain man

customer_reviews.title: Stasis Chamber for Hot or Cold Beverage!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. It keeps my coffee hot long enough that I forget I have coffee only to remember much later to find the coffee is still hot. It seems it actually side steps laws of thermodynamics, which as an engineer I find perplexing. My only minor gripe is that the outer diameter of the mug is sufficiently large to prevent it from fitting in the cup holders in my truck. It's also a little big to just palm if you have small hobbit hands like mine. I need to use the handle, but it's a nice handle so no problem there.
customer_reviews.author: Joz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for parents who have to re heat their coffee too much
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned several of these. They are a game changer in defeating the issue of having to reheat your morning coffee 3 plus times to finish it and a morning routine with kids. I rarely use it on the go because it doesn’t fit in my cup holder in my car but I use it at home daily. It has zero trouble keeping my coffee hot. Often times I leave the lif off for a few minutes to let it cool some before I put the lid on and drink it. Other wise it’ll stay too hot to drink for 30 minutes lol
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Bean

customer_reviews.title: Yeti Rambler
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't fit in the car/truck, but it's great for in the house for keeping the coffee warm for as long as it takes to drink it. My husband has this one, I prefer the smaller sized one. Can be used to keep liquids cold as well. I have 5 dogs and 4 cats, so I make my coffee, tend to the animals and my coffee is still warm once my chores are done, and although it won't fit in my cup-holder, it stays put on my passenger seat if I still have coffee left when I leave for work.
customer_reviews.author: 98northwood

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mug for hot and cold drinks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mug to use to keep my coffee warm and my wine and other drinks cool. I often will make a cup of coffee in the morning and walk off and forget it for 15 minutes and find that it is too cold to drink. I would often get frustrated and just pour my coffee down the drain rather than reheat it. This mug has kept my coffee warm for an hour and I love it! I plan on buying an extra lid that closes so that I can take it boating. I would definitely recommend this mug!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: caveat emptor(sic)
customer_reviews.text: this may have been the ripoff of the year. what a total waste. warmed the cup, poured about half from the keurig machine and immediately put the lid on. less than an hour later the coffee was lukewarm at best. in the manufacturers defense, it will probably may a great pen and pencil holder. no wait, i can use it for a plant. NEVER AGAIN
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Treger

customer_reviews.title: I dropped it first day
customer_reviews.text: So I havent even had it 2 days. Filled it with coffee and was leaving for work dropped it and my keys on my cement porch. The Tumbler, did just that. It dropped tumbled right side up and barely any coffee spilled out, no crack, no scratches or anything. I was amazed! I thought maybe the top would come off. No. Still inside sealed perfectly. Keeps my coffee pretty warm for about 4 hours. And I have the lid that came with it. So the other one the actually closes I read is even better. Either way, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Lula Forest

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I saw several bloggers rave about these so I asked for one for christmas. Wow, worth the hype! You do need to put the lid on but your coffee will stay HOT and fresh for hours (ok, warm for hours and hot for at least an hour). I honestly am not that picky with my coffee and didn't think I really cared about it staying hot but every time I take a sip out of this thing I say DAMN THAT'S GOOD! I have a white one and ordered the navy one for my husband and he loves it too. Great gift for coffee lovers in your life!
customer_reviews.author: JTS

customer_reviews.title: Seals tightly
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. My only criticism is that sometimes when you place hot liquids in, it seals TOO tightly and it is almost impossible to take off. So just ensure that when you close it, you don't plan to open the actual lid again for a while lol. But I love this. I bought the tealish one. I love the colour, very durable, keeps liquids hot or cold, easy to hold, holds a lot of juice, sometimes I even put my quaker oats in it as I am running out of the door on mornings! Love it! love it! love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sending it Back
customer_reviews.text: Sending this back. I would rather see the cup a little taller and make the handle larger so you can hold on to it better. The width of the handle is fine, it just needs to be bigger. I understand why it is wider to make it more stable, but I would rather sacrifice a little stability, to be able to hold on to it better. And actually my old plastic one kept my coffee hotter longer than this one.
customer_reviews.author: John Rola

customer_reviews.title: Which size to order!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use at work. After using this for a couple of days I’ve decided that I ordered the wrong one 😞. When your coffee gets low it’s hard to get the remaining coffee out of the mug without taking the lid off. It looks good on my desk though! I WISH NOW THAT I WOULD HAVE ORDERED THE 20 OZ TUMBLER!! At least then you’d get the very last drop without having to take the lid off!! Was so excited to get it and now very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the coffee hot!
customer_reviews.text: I got my husband one of these for Christmas. Turns out he had the same idea for me! I use mine in our camper but he loves his so much he wanted one for the house too, so we ordered another one. It keeps the coffee nice and hot even when your two young kids distract you from drinking it for 30 minutes! I love that it’s a coffee mug shape rather than a traditional travel mug. It won’t fit in the cup holders obviously, but it’s perfect for camping or at home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No top closures
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this product. I have heard so much about yeti that i finally decide to try them. The top does not have closure so the heat escapes. The coffee is cold by the time you get to the bottom. It is rather large and difficult to hold. I purchased a Thermos Stainless King 16-Ounce Travel Tumbler and love it. the top closes easily, it will not spill when closed, it's easy to hold, and it holds in the heat such that the last drop is just as hot as the first. Yeti needs to make a lid that closes.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for tea and coffee
customer_reviews.text: We don't have a microwave so when coffee or tea gets cold, there's virtually no way of warming it back up other than putting it in a sauce pan on the stove. I know there are off brands, etc., but the price isn't bad and I liked the color. It works very well. I usually make tea and let it cool off until it's almost cool enough to drink then put the lid on. I can then take my time and enjoy drinking my tea whereas before it was a race against the clock or I'd end up drinking cold tea.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Swims

customer_reviews.title: What you see is what you get
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my sister and ended up returning it Bc she didn’t like the color. She thought it would be a pastel purple but as you can see- it’s not. I thought the color was great, but I already have the same yeti in white so I didn’t keep it. This particular cup doesn’t keep my beverages as warm as my other yeti cups but that’s Bc the top is nothing but plastic. But it still keeps my coffee warm for a long time as I sip my coffee through the day.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Diana

customer_reviews.title: High quality mug
customer_reviews.text: High quality product which is more than I can say for many products these days. I was always hesitant about spending the money on Yeti products because I didn't see how the value could meet/exceed the price. It really does. The mug is very well made, and it keeps my coffee at the right temperature for at least a good hour or more. For anyone uncertain on how not having a slider piece over the opening in the top will effect its ability to keep your drink hot, it doesn't seem to at all.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fashion and Function Combined
customer_reviews.text: IF YOU DON'T OWN A YETI YOU NEED ONE. My coffee stays hot for hours and my water stays cold and even the ice in it has lasted like two days when I've forgotten about it in my car. Now my friends and I look like the yeti power rangers walking to class in the morning. The only down side to this cup is you may need to buy a second top piece that closes on top if you really want to be portable and it doesn't quite fit in my car cupholder if i'm on the go with coffee. Yeti sells tops separately and ZAK! brand from Target tops also fit these.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Gwyn Snowe

customer_reviews.title: I got unlucky
customer_reviews.text: My first order, there were tiny dents at the base of the mug, so I requested a replacement. I received my replacement the next evening, which was impressive. Unfortunately, the replacement also had small dents at the base of the mug. At that point, I gave up and returned my order. I ended up going to Dicks Sporting Goods and bought the Yeti mug (same price). Otherwise, the mug itself is great, I highly recommend it. I just got very unlucky with my product via Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: P.Y.Y.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it promises
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my coffee warm for a long time, just don't expect miracles. Your coffee isn't going to be hot 8 hours later. I like the stainless steel construction, and the magnetic, sliding lip is genius. It allows you to simply lift it up for cleaning, but works great to keep my coffee from spilling. My only complaint is that I wish it was taller and narrower. This is for two reasons. I think it would hold the heat in even better, and it would fit in a cup holder.
customer_reviews.author: LowKey

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really into the Yeti thing, but we ordered it. It works just as well as my $7 walmart stainless mugs. We ordered a lid separate because the lid that comes with it just has a slit, and doesn't have the open/close slider. I really don't notice any difference between Yeti and the cheaper ones, except the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mayo

customer_reviews.title: To bulky
customer_reviews.text: For me it is a total waist of money. 1. Doesn't keep coffee hot because the lid is so large the heat goes right through. 2. The cup and the lid are so large (thick) its hard to get your lips around them and then they drip. 3. It doesn't fit any car cup holder. Yeti does a great job keeping cold drinks cold but doesn't work well on hot drinks, I've called them about a Rambler I own and they told me sorry about that. In conclusion to much money for a product that doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Scan

customer_reviews.title: Lid Sucks
customer_reviews.text: I own 2 of these mugs. I had to replace both lids due to poor design. May times the coffee simply will not come out of the lid opening unless I tilt the cup more, then it rushes out and spills and can scald you. The new lids at $10 each are much better and in my opinion should be the standard. Be prepared to spend another $10 for a total of $35. Is it worth it? I contacted yeti support about this on their FB page, but no one ever answered me.
customer_reviews.author: D. M.

product_meta.title: YETI Rambler 14 oz Mug, Stainless Steel, Vacuum Insulated with Standard Lid
feature_bullets: The YETI Rambler 14 oz Mug is the toughest, most over-engineered camp mug out there
The full-loop Triple Grip Handle is comfortable for wider hands, so you can fit your mitts fully around your morning joe
Duracoat color means no scratching, peeling, or fading here
Double-wall vacuum insulation keeps cold drinks cold and hot drinks hot until the last sip
No sweat design say adios to damp or frostbit fingers. And of course dishwasher safe

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
